title: Fix circular dependency issue - only allow blocked_by
description: Issues can currently set both blocking and blocked_by, creating circular dependencies. Fix by: 1) Only allow blocked_by to be set directly, 2) Make blocking list purely computed, 3) Update edit UI to only show "Add Blocked by", 4) Simplify dependency selector

acceptance_criteria.text: Issues only store blocked_by relationships in their dependencies array
Blocking list is computed from other issues' dependencies
Edit UI only shows 'Add Blocked by' button
Dependency selector modal simplified - no direction toggle
Blocking list is read-only in UI (no remove button)

comments.author: agent
comments.content:
Fixed the circular dependency issue by implementing unidirectional dependency management:

1. **UI Changes**:
   - Updated IssueEdit to only show "Add Blocked by" button
   - Added read-only "This issue is blocking" section with computed dependencies
   - Made TaskList's onRemove optional to support read-only lists
   - Simplified DependencySelectionModal by removing direction toggle

2. **Backend Changes**:
   - Updated extension.ts to compute blocking list from other issues' dependencies
   - Modified save logic to only store blocked_by relationships
   - Removed bidirectional dependency management code

3. **Result**:
   - Issues can now only define what blocks them (blocked_by)
   - What they block is purely computed
   - Eliminates possibility of circular dependencies from bidirectional management
   - Simplifies dependency selector UX

Build successful with no errors.

title: Fix issue list to only show parent-child as hierarchy
description: Blocked items are incorrectly rendering as children to their blockers in the main issue list. Only parent-child relationships should create hierarchical structure. Blocking dependencies should not affect the tree structure.

acceptance_criteria.text: Only parent-child dependencies create hierarchical tree structure
Blocks dependencies do not affect tree rendering
Blocked items appear at root level, not as children of blockers

comments.author: agent
comments.content:
Fixed the useTaskHierarchy hook to only create hierarchical relationships for parent-child dependencies. 

**Changes:**
- Removed the logic that was adding blocked items as children to their blockers
- Added clarifying comment that 'blocks' dependencies are for dependency tracking only, not tree structure
- Blocked items now appear at root level unless they have a parent-child relationship

**Result:**
- Only sub-issues (parent-child) are rendered as children in the tree
- Blocking dependencies no longer affect the visual hierarchy
- Build successful

title: Make blocked status computed from dependencies
description: Remove 'blocked' as an assignable status. Compute it dynamically based on whether an issue has incomplete blocked_by dependencies. Update UI, filters, and storage to handle this properly.

acceptance_criteria.text: Status dropdown does not show 'blocked' as an option
Blocked status computed from incomplete blocked_by dependencies
Status filter works with computed blocked status
Task list displays blocked badge when dependencies are incomplete

comments.author: agent
comments.content:
Made 'blocked' status computed based on dependencies instead of being manually assignable.

**Changes:**

1. **Core Type Update** ([types.ts](e:\Workspace\cairn\packages\core\src\types.ts)):
   - Removed 'blocked' from IssueStatus type
   - Status is now: 'open' | 'in_progress' | 'closed'

2. **UI Updates** ([IssueEdit.tsx](e:\Workspace\cairn\packages\vscode-extension\src\components\IssueEdit.tsx)):
   - Removed 'blocked' from status dropdown options
   - Users can only set open, in_progress, or closed

3. **Computed Status Logic** ([utils.ts](e:\Workspace\cairn\packages\vscode-extension\src\components\utils.ts)):
   - Added isIssueBlocked() function to check if any 'blocks' dependency is incomplete
   - Added getComputedStatus() to return 'blocked' when dependencies are incomplete

4. **Filter Support** ([useTaskFiltering.ts](e:\Workspace\cairn\packages\vscode-extension\src\components\hooks\useTaskFiltering.ts)):
   - Updated to check computed blocked status when 'blocked' filter is active
   - Filter correctly shows issues blocked by incomplete dependencies

5. **Display** ([TaskRow.tsx](e:\Workspace\cairn\packages\vscode-extension\src\components\TaskRow.tsx)):
   - Already had logic to compute and display blocked status
   - Works seamlessly with new approach

**Result:**
- Blocked status is now purely computed from blocked_by dependencies
- An issue shows as blocked if any of its blocking dependencies are not closed
- Status filter works correctly with computed blocked status
- Simpler data model - no manual blocked status management

title: Address AI Review Findings for React Refactor PR
Verify .gitignore includes all relevant files (source maps, media)
Update docs/extension/index.md to reflect new media files and React components
Verify package-lock.json updates don't introduce breaking changes
Add thorough tests for cycle detection in calculateCompletionPercentage
Update all references to old cairn-icon.png name
Confirm edit.html and index.html are obsolete and not referenced
Test application after package.json dependency updates
Add documentation and tests for new React components
Review TaskGrid rendering logic for large dataset efficiency
Run comprehensive tests, update documentation, and ensure code quality
Store only blocked_by dependencies; compute blocks
description: Refactor core and extension to store only 'blocked_by' dependencies in issues.jsonl and compute 'blocks' relationships. Add migration to convert existing stored 'blocks' to 'blocked_by' and dedupe mutual edges. Update graph API, status/ready/blocked computations, extension load/save logic, and validation. Ensure full test coverage and successful build.

acceptance_criteria.text: Core types include 'blocked_by' and no new 'blocks' written during saves
Storage migration converts existing 'blocks' to 'blocked_by' and dedupes mutual edges
Extension load/save shows blockers from 'blocked_by' and ignores 'blocks' from UI

comments.author: agent
comments.content: Implemented core and extension changes to store only 'blocked_by' dependencies and compute 'blocks' for UI. Migration converts legacy 'blocks' to 'blocked_by' and dedupes mutual edges. Updated graph computations to use 'blocked_by' semantics while retaining support for legacy 'blocks'. All core (108) and extension (18) tests passing, and build succeeds.

title: Fix task list webview CSP: use panel.webview.cspSource
description: Resolve runtime error 'webview is not defined' in cairn.openTaskList by referencing panel.webview.cspSource in HTML CSP meta. Verify build succeeds and task list opens without errors.
